message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a neural network-based model for event detection in Chinese text. The model uses a character-wise paradigm to propose trigger nuggets and learn a hybrid representation for each character. This approach is specifically designed to address the word-trigger mismatch problem in languages without natural word delimiters such as Chinese. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves machine learning techniques such as neural networks and proposes a novel approach for event detection, which makes it relevant to sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on two datasets, which makes it relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as well.
